CREAMY CAJUN CHICKEN SAUSAGE PENNE
CHICKEN
A spicy blending of chicken and pasta. Well worth the time investment.

1 Roma Tomato, 2 Cloves of Garlic, 1 Package of Pene Pasta, 1/2 Pound of Chicken Sausage Mix, 1/2 tablespoon of blackening spice, 2 tablespoons of chicken stock concentrate, 2 tablespoons of cream cheese, Shredded Monterey Jack Cheese, 2 Tablespoons of Vegetable Oil, 1 Tablespoon of Butter, Kosher Salt, Table Salt, Black Pepper
Stove, Medium Pot, Cutting Board, Knife, Measuring Cup, Strainer, Large Pan, Stirring Spoon, 1/2 tablespoon, tablespoon
STEP 1. Bring a medium pot of salted water to a boil. Wash and dry all produce. Dice tomato. Peel and thinly slice garlic.
STEP 2. Once water is boiling, add pasta to pot. Cook until al dente, 9 – 11 minutes. Reserve 1 cup pasta cooking water, then drain.

STEP 3. Meanwhile, heat a large drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add sausage and cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned and cooked through, 4 to 6 minutes. Add garlic and blackening spice. Cook, stirring, until fragrant, 1 minute.

STEP 4. Stir tomato, stock concentrate, and 1/2 cup reserved pasta cooking water into pan with sausage mixture. Cook until sauce is slightly reduced, 2-3 minutes. Lower heat to medium and stir in cream cheese and 1 tablespoon of butter until melted. Turn off heat.

STEP 5. Add pasta to pan with sauce; stir to thoroughly Combine. If sauce is too think, add more reserved pasta cooking water, a splash at a time, until everything is coated in a creamy sauce. Divide between bowls and sprinkle with cheese.
TUSCAN HERBED CHICKEN
CHICKEN
A combination chicken and pasta dish. It's zesty, creamy, and all-around tasty.

1 Roma Tomato, 3 Cloves of Garlic, 2 teaspoons of tuscan heat spice, 2 chicken breasts, linguine pasta, 3 tablespoon of cream cheese, 1 cup shredded parmesan, 2 tablespoons of butter, 1 tablespoon of olive oil, table salt, pepper, optionally kosher salt (for pasta water)
Cutting board, knife, medium bowl, paper towels, large pot, measuring cup, large pan
STEP 1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Kosher salt is reccomended here. Wash and dry all produce. Dice tomato. Peel garlic; thinly slice two cloves and finely chop remaining clove.

STEP 2. Place chicken in a medium bowl; pat dry with paper towels. Add a large drizzle of olive oil, chopped garlic, half the Tuscan Heat Spice (you'll use the rest later), salt, and pepper; turn chicken to thoroughly coat. Set aside. Once water is boiling, add pasta to pot. Cook until al dente, 9 - 11 minutes. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta cooking water then drain.

STEP 3. While pasta cooks, heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, 6 - 8 minutes per side (if chicken starts to brown too quickly, lower heat). Turn off heat; transfer chciken to a cutting board. Once cool enough to handle, thinly slice crosswise.

STEP 4. Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in same pan over medium heat. Add sliced garlic; cook, stirring, until fragrant, 1 minute. Add tomato, remaining tuscan heat spice, salt, and pepper. Cook, stirring, until softened, 2 - 3 minutes.

STEP 5. Stir cream cheese, half the parmesan (you'll use the rest later), and half the reserved pasta cooking water into pan with tomato mixture. Bring to a simmer, then stir in drained pasta (if necessary, stir in more reserved pasta cooking water a splash at a time until pasta is coated in a creamy sauce.) Turn off heat; taste and season with salt and pepper.
STEP 6. Divide pasta mixture between plates. Top with sliced chicken and remaining parmesan.
COWBOY SKILLET PIE
BEEF
A filling and hearty blend of meat and veggies

5 Yukon Gold Potatoes, 1 Long Green Pepper, 1 Yellow Onion, 3 Cloves of Garlic, 1 jalapñeo, 1/2 pound of ground beef, 1 tablespoon of Southwest Spice, 1 tablespoon of Beef Stock Concentrate, 1/3 cup of sour cream, Kosher Salt, table salt, Black Pepper, 1 tablespoon of flour, 2 tablespoons of butter, 1 teaspoon of Vegetable Oil, 1 tablespoon of Ketchup, 1/2 cup of water, optionally a 1/2 cup of milk if you want extra creamy mashed potatoes.

Cutting Board, knife, medium pot, medium ovenproof pan (or, if you don't have an ovenproof pan,a medium pan and baking dish), strainer, measuring cup, stove, broiler, wooden stirring spoon, tablespoon, teaspoon

STEP 1. Heat broiler to high. Wash and dry all produce. Dice potatoes into 1/2-inch pieces. Core, deseed, and cut green pepper into a medium dice. Halve, peel, and cut onion into a small dice. Peel and finely chop garlic. Finely chop jalapñeo, removing ribs and seeds for less head.

STEP 2. Place potatoes in a medium pot with enough salted water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil and cook until very tender, 12 - 15 minutes. Drain and return potatoes to pot. Keep covered off heat.

STEP 3. Meanwhile, heat a drizzle of oil in a medium, preferably ovenproof, pan over medium-high heat. Add green pepper and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly browned, 3-4 minutes. Add onion and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until softened and lightly browned, 4-5 minutes.

STEP 4. Add garlic, Southwest Spice, and as much jalapñeo as you'd like to pan with veggies. Cook, stirring, until fragrant, 30 seconds. Add beef and a pinch of salt and pepper. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until beef is browned and cooked through, 4-5 minutes. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of flour. Cook, stirring to coat, 1 minute.

STEP 5. Gradually stir 1/2 cup water, stock concentrate, and 1 tablespoon of ketchup into pan with beef mixture. Simmer until thickened, 1-2 minutes. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Turn off heat. (if your pan isn't ovenproof, transfer mixture to a baking dish.)

STEP 6. Mash potatoes with sour cream and 2 tablespoons of butter. Add splashes of water (or milk for extra creaminess) as necessary until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Spread mashed potatoes on top of beef mixture, leaving a 1-inch gap around edge of skillet. Broil until bubbling, 3-4 minutes. (Watch carefully, the broiler is a powerful tool). Sprinkle with any remaining jalapñeo to taste.
CRISPY PARM FRICO BURGERS
BEEF
A burger topped with caramelized onion and parmesan frico. Wedges on the side make this a basic staple for any barbecue.

5 Yukon Gold Potatoes, 1 Yellow Onion, 2 Buns, 1/2 pound of ground beef, 2 tablespoons of soy sauce, shredded parmesan cheese, 1 clove of garlic, 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil, 1 teaspoon of sugar, 1 tablespoon of butter, table salt, pepper, 1/4 cup water optionally ketchup for dipping sauce and burger topping.
oven, stove, microwave, large pan, cutting board, knife, wooden stirring spoon, spatula, spoon, small microwave-safe bowl, measuring cup, teaspoon, tablespoon.

STEP 1. Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Wash and dry all produce. Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch-thick wedges. Halve, peel, and thinly slice onion. Peel and finely chop garlic. Halve buns. Toss potatoes on a baking sheet with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast until lightly browned, 15 - 18 minutes (you'll add more to the baking sheet then).

STEP 2. While potatoes roast, heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until softened and lightly browned, 8 - 10 minutes.

STEP 3. Meanwhile, form beef into two patties, each about 1/2 inch thick; season all over with salt and pepper. Set aside. Place 1 tablespoon of butter and garlic in a small microwave-safe bowl; microwave for 30 seconds. Brush onto cut sides of buns.

STEP 4. Once onion is softened, add soy sauce, 1/4 cup water, and 1 teaspoon of sugar. Cook, stirring, until onion is caramelized and jammy, 2 - 3 minutes. Turn off heat; transfer to a second small bowl, and set aside. Wash out pan.

STEP 5. Once potatoes are lightly browned, remove sheet from oven; push potatoes to one side. Mound parmesan on empty side in two even piles, each about the width of a burger bun. Place buns cut sides up on a separate sheet or directly on oven rack. Roast until cheese is melted and crispy at edges, potatoes are tender, and buns are golden brown, 5 - 6 minutes. Immediately transfer parmesan frico to a plate to cool.

STEP 6. Meanwhile, heat a drizzle of oil in pan used for onion over medium-high heat. Add patties and cook to desired donness, 3 - 5 minutes per side. Divide buns between plates and fill with patties, caramelized onion, and parmesan frico. Serve with potato wedges alongside. If you've got some ketchup spread top buns with it and serve a bit of it on the side for dipping.
